info.name: Werebat - Waterdeep Dungeon of the Mad Mage

element.name: Werebat
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: A werebat is a humanoid afflicted with a rare form of lycanthropy that enables it to transform into a giant bator a bat-humanoid hybrid. (See the Monster Manual formore information on lycanthropy.) Most werebats are of goblin stock.

Deep Dwellers. Werebats are shunned even by goblin society because of their need to feed on blood to survive. They prefer to lair in dark places, such as attics and caves, and typically adopt nocturnal hunting habits.

element.name: Shapeshifter
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: The werebat can use its action to polymorph into a Medium bat-humanoid hybrid, or into a Large giant bat, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't t ransformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

sheet.description: You can transform into a tiny raven or your hybrid form. End the transformation if you die.

element.name: Werebat Speed
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: Speed 30 ft. (climb 30 ft., fly 60 ft. in bat or hybrid form)

sheet.description: Speed 30 ft. (climb 30 ft., fly 60 ft. in bat or hybrid form)

element.name: Werebat Dexterity
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: A player character who becomes a werebat gains a Dexterity of 17 if their score isn't already higher.

element.name: Werebat Resistance
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non magical weapons that aren't silvered in Raven or Hybrid Form.

sheet.description: You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non magical weapons that aren't silvered.

element.name: Keen Hearing
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: (Bat or Hybrid Form Only). The werebat has blindsight out to a range of 60 feet as long as it's not deafened. The werebat has advantage on Wisdom (PercepÂ· tion) checks that rely on hearing.

element.name: Nimble Escape
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: (Humanoid Form Only) The werebat can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

sheet.description: (Humanoid Form Only) The werebat can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

element.name: Blood Drinkers
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: A werebat must consume at least 1 pint of fresh blood each night, or it weakens and gains one level of exhaustion that no amount of rest alone can remove. Each pint of blood the werebat consumes removes one level of exhaustion gained in this fashion.

sheet.description: A werebat must consume at least 1 pint of fresh blood each night, or it weakens and gains one level of exhaustion that no amount of rest alone can remove. Each pint of blood the werebat consumes removes one level of exhaustion gained in this fashion.

element.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: While in sunlight, the werebat has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.. You also have darkvision with a range of 60 ft.

element.name: Multiattack
element.source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.p: (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only). In humanoid form, the werebat makes two scimitar attacks or two shortbow attacks. In hybrid form, it can make one bite attack and one scimitar attack.

sheet.description: (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only). In humanoid form, the werebat makes two light weapon attacks. In hybrid form, it can make one bite attack and one weapon attack.The werebat makes two weapon attacks, one of which can be with its light weapon.
